data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You will always take 9 steps left on the left path. You will always take the next 9 steps in the same direction. You will always face forward when you take 9 steps left on the left path. You will always take the next 9 steps in the same direction. Whenever you take 9 steps right on the right path, you actually go 6 steps right. Luckily there are also 10 steps back in a circular direction. Obviously you would take the previous 9 steps in the same direction and back 10 steps back on the right one. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around means turn in the direction that you are going. Right turns are made the same way. Thus, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Let' s say you go to the opposite location and go back 6 steps. Then turn around and take 4 steps. So if you don't want to take 10 steps you take this number of steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn left means take 5 steps. The total number of steps to turn left is 7 + 1 = 9. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow the third step, you will always return to the starting point and not back to the beginning. The final answer: No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 7 steps to get to the starting point. Take 7 steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You only have to turn right twice in order to get back to start point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point, you take 6 steps, turn around, take 8 steps and take 2 steps. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person should always face forward without taking one step to the left. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let’s say our first step is 9 steps. If we turn our way around, we would take around 2 steps. If we take 6 steps, we would have to turn around once again and take 7 steps for it to return to the first location. In total, we would have to take 9 steps + 7 steps + 2 steps+ 9 steps = 54 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The following sentences go in reverse order, always facing forward, forward 1, backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward. You always take 6 steps right. You always take 8 steps right. You always take 5 steps left. You always take 2 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is facing toward the right. The instructions point in the same direction as it has to travel. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always start at the start. There is no need to turn around to face into the right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you go in the wrong direction, you lose one step. One step backwards would result in ending up in the same direction you started. If you always face forward, you can go backwards too. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and back at the starting point. Take 4 steps and turn around again. Take 8 steps and turn right to turn around again. Take 8 steps and turn around again. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take a new number that’ s a product of (into) and to. Take three steps next to the starting number. The final answer: No.

If you follow the first instruction correctly you can return to the starting point without turning right. So, the answer is No.

Turn around to the right. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. So, the answer is No.

You don’ t take 7 steps so you are moving backwards. To turn right, take one step and take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 1 step to go back to the starting point, then you are taking 2 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

The following instructions take 15 steps, including turning around. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

Turning around and turning around are the same steps. Those step sequences should all take 7 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

A person has to go forward if they are going backward. Therefore, the answer is No.

There are multiple ways to go backward. You could backwards look forward at the top of the hill. There are multiple ways to go left. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is indicated by the four steps leading backwards. Thus, the answer is yes.

After each step you turn 90o to the right and the starting point should be at the point. In the first step you return to your original step. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn right into the street, look for the street corner on the right, turn right. After 5 steps turn to the right, take another 5 steps and turn around, again looking for the street corner on the right. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, even if you take 2 steps backward, it will still have you back to where you started. If you always take 3 steps backward then, yes, you will still be at a start point. As far as the previous instructions were concerned, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can take a number of steps to revert back to your original position. If 3 steps are taken, you will take 3. If 10 steps are taken, you will take 10. If 4 steps are taken, you will take 4. If 1 step is taken, you will take 1. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow the instructions and turn around after 9 steps, you will turn around after 6 steps. So, the answer is No.

Doing Step One for now means facing forward. In the directions, you always face forward. In the instructions, you always face backward. So, the answer is yes.

They tell you to always face forward. They tell you to take five steps backwards. So, the answer is no.

Place one hand in one hand and point back and forth. The curved line of the stairs must be matched to the curved line of the path to get back the direction you began. So, the answer is Yes.

The first step is always forward. From here until you are facing backward, the steps are reversed. The next step is facing forward. To go backward while facing forward, you are going to take 9 steps. If you are facing forward, your feigned forward, then your step is backward. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward, you can never lose sight of where you are moving and what you are to be doing. If you follow the instructions, you are bound to get where you want to go. It' s hard to get where you want to be until you return to where you started. So, the answer is No.

Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take right 6 steps first then two steps left. Take 4 steps right to return to your starting point then two steps right then four steps left. Follow the instructions to the letter E to return to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you have a number of ways of taking steps backward, you could always take 10 steps forward. If you follow the instructions by number, you take 8 steps backward, which is to say 10 steps forward. Keep going forward and face forward in order until you always turn your face to the right and keep going the same way. Always facing forward is not a reversal. There are 10 steps left to take. So, the answer is No.
